title: Life Changing (Part 4)
body:
Note: All right, turns out I suck at planning… Long story short, there’ll be one more chapter (I think lol) and an epilogue, I suppose… I’m sorry? Idk… Anyway, I really like this chapter, I hope you do too, please let me know what you think <3

Summary: We go to space! Yayyy!

Warnings: Captain Marvel spoilers

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Reader

Words: 2639

You can find the links to the previous parts in the comments or on my masterlist (the link is in my bio) :)

.

“Come on, L/N,” you felt someone shake your shoulder, “No rest for the wicked.”

Groaning you opened your eyes and flinched back a little when you saw Fury hovering over you.

“Get ready,” he told you, you could swear he smirked a little, “Talos’ science guy is ready with the jet.”

While Fury left the living room again, you sat up on the couch and reached for the boots you had left beside the sofa before going to sleep – well, rather before taking a nap… The clock on the wall told you, you hadn’t slept more than two hours.

“‘He won’t be ready before dawn’ he said,” you grumbled, “It’s still fucking dark outside…”

Laughter from behind you made you jump up and turn around abruptly.

“So, I guess you aren’t a morning person, then,” Carol grinned at you.

“I am, if I had a proper night’s sleep…” you replied rolling your eyes and joined her on the way outside.

“If it’s any consolation the sun will start rising in about half an hour, so they weren’t that far off with their guess,” Carol nudged your side and you laughed.

“I like your new look by the way,” you said giving her a once over. She had changed her suit’s colours from teal, black and grey to red, blue and gold and it suited her rather well, if you dared to say so.

“Thanks,” she looked down at herself, “I had a little help from Monica.”

“Of course, I wouldn’t have trusted anyone else’s advice either,” you nodded, “Where is she by the way?”

“Her grandparents picked her up, she’ll be safe with them.”

You smiled at Carol and reached for hand to give it a reassuring squeeze, she felt guilty for bringing Maria and Monica this close to danger in the first place, you could see it in her eyes. She looked back at you smiling too and when you wanted to let go of her hand, she didn’t let you, instead Carol only tightened her grip around it.

Suddenly a bit shy, she evaded your gaze as you continued to walk, but you didn’t mind, not at all. The walk over the lawn was shorter than you wished it to be, soon you arrived at the little hangar, where you couldn’t help, but stare amazed at the quadjet. It had looked fancy even before the skrull had worked on it, but now it really nearly looked like a spaceship.

It was only when Maria cleared her throat and gave a pointed look at your and Carol’s intertwined hands, that you two jumped apart. While you both tried to cover your embarrassment Maria only laughed. Luckily, Fury was inside the jet with Talos, you were sure he wouldn’t have stopped teasing you the entire flight, if he had seen you.

“There you are!” Fury appeared again, the skrulls close on his heel. “Ready to go to space?”

You and Maria exchanged a glance, hell yeah, you were ready… Space for christ’s sake…

“It still works pretty much the same way as before,” Talos’ science guy told Carol, “Just a few changes here and there… You should be fine.”

“Thank you,” Carol replied.

The skrull nodded shortly and you started to frown.

“You aren’t coming with us?”

He shook his head and smiled sadly at you.

“He’ll stay behind,” Carol finally explained, “Yon-Rogg will track my signal back to this place and we need all the extra time we can get.”

“No way,” you protested.

“It was my idea,” the skrull interrupted you and smiled, “I’ll be fine.”

Before you or anyone else could protest further, he symmed Carol and, to be honest, that did shut you up for a while… You were torn somewhere in between being amazed and weirded out.

The skrull seemed amused by your reactions judging by the very Carol-like smirk on his lips. Fury only shook his head and picked Goose up who was walking around his legs.

“Come on, let’s get going,” he said.

While you boarded the jet, Talos stayed back, probably to say his farewells properly and you all gave him the time gladly. Maria and Carol walked into the cockpit, both feeling immediately at home. Behind their two seats were three more and it only took you and Fury to exchange one glance to agree that you’d take Talos in between the two of you, so while you took the seat behind Maria, he took the one behind Carol, leaving the one in the middle for your new ally.

Talos only rolled his eyes when he entered. “Take that creature away at least…”

“Not a chance,” Fury replied cooing at Goose, causing you to laugh. He narrowed his eyes at you. “One word to any other agent…” he threatened.

Smirking you raised your arms in surrender. “Don’t worry, your secret’s safe with me. No one at SHIELD will ever know ‘Don’t-you-dare-call-me-Nick’ Fury has a soft spot for kitties.”

Carol laughed in the pilot’s seat as she flicked a couple of switches. “Buckle up, folks.”

You did as she asked and grinned at her. “Ready, Danvers?”

She looked over her shoulder and grinned back at you. “Higher, further, faster, baby.”

Maria laughed beside her. “Something’s telling me this time you’re certainly going to keep that promise.”

Carol feigned hurt. “What do you mean, this time?”

Your attention was taken from the two women, when Talos leaned into your side. You shoved him back, but he still scooted closer to you and you realized he was just trying to get every possible inch of space between him and Goose. When Fury realized that too, he laughed and cuddled the cat even more.

“You really shouldn’t have that thing on your lap,” Talos tried to tell him, but your boss only smirked.

“As long as our alliance stands on shaky ground and you are frightened of her,” he proved his point by holding Goose into Talos’ direction, who instantly flinched back, “The cat stays.”

Talos’ frightened expression made way for a confused look. “What’s a cat?”

“Can I ask you a question?” Maria suddenly asked, stopping the two from bickering.

“Sure,” Talos shrugged.

“Can all of you change your appearance?”

“Physiologically? Yes.” He answered. “But it requires practice and, dare I say, talent to-“

“So, you could change into anything?” Maria interrupted.

“If I see it first…”

While Fury and Maria started to suggest the weirdest things for him to turn into, you zoned out, preferring the sight out of the front shield to their conversation. Finally, you were called back by Carol’s voice.

“Alright, guys,” she shot you a quick glance, “Hold on…”

The jet rattled and shook when you started to brake through the atmosphere, so much so, that you started to question the stability of the ship, especially considering the recent provisional adjustments… Luckily the ‘space turbulances’ (as Fury called it) were over nearly as soon as they started and you suddenly found yourself in complete absence of gravity.

The feeling of weightlessness was difficult to describe, but it was something you definitely wouldn’t forget all too quickly. You looked in wonder at your own arms, that had risen without you having any influence on it. It was then, that the realization, that you really were in space, settled in and you couldn’t help but laugh a little.

Carol soon pressed a few buttons that activated some sort of gravity stabilizer, it felt like something tugged at your stomach and for a second you feared you might grow sick. The feeling passed quickly though and you finally were able to focus on the absolutely marvelous sight on front of you. There were so many stars, stretching out until forever – but not a sign of Mar-Vell’s laboratory.

“Here it is,” Carol said, “We’re right were it’s supposed to be…”

“The question is,” Fury objected, “Is it in front or behind of all that nothing?”

Carol didn’t pay him any mind, instead she smiled and lifted her hand, she typed away on the little display on her forearm whereupon a huge spacecraft appeared in front of you. You’d be astounded, but the truth was, that wasn’t by far the craziest thing you had witnessed in the last 24 hours.

Carol and Maria piloted the jet into the landing dock of the lab, touching down gently and with no complications.

“That was amazing,” you whispered causing Talos to smile at you and give you a little pat on your shoulder, before exiting the jet quickly.

At first you blamed that on his want to get away from Goose, but you started to doubt that theory when it seemed that he couldn’t make his way through the lab fast enough. Carol kept up with his pace, while the rest of you decided to be a bit more careful when it came to exploring.

The inside of the lab reminded you more of a factory than of a spaceship, the faint buzz of the engine was omnipresent, but except for that and the echo of your footsteps it was completely silent.

You had walked through a couple of corridors, taking so many turns that you feared you might not find your way back to the hangar if you had to, when you finally reached a larger room, full of tech and other stuff, you wouldn’t have expected to find there… You really should have been gawking at the glowing blue cube in the center of the room, but while the others were already busy with that, you couldn’t help but wonder about the pin-ball machine at the other end of the room.

As you made your way over there you noticed toys lying in between scientific notes and underneath the tables. You turned around frowning and saw Fury rummaging through all the stuff too. You both spotted the steaming cup on the table at the same time and looked at each other alerted.

“We aren’t alone…” he said and in that same moment Talos started to make sounds that reminded you oddly of whale song.

Before you knew it, skrulls emerged from every corner of the ship, surrounding you. Talos looked around searching for something – someone and he didn’t have to do so for long… A woman appeared to your right and as if he sensed her Talos turned around. They took a tentative step closer to each other, before they ran into each other’s arms.

You smiled softly when they hugged each other as close as possible and a child walked out of the shadows, encouraged by her mother.

“He wasn’t looking for the Tesseract,” Maria whispered beside you.

Talos and his family turned around to you and his wife and child stepped back afraid when they spotted Carol.

“It’s all right,” Talos immediately comforted them, “She’s helped me find you.”

You turned to look at Carol, tears brimmed in her eyes as she took a few steps forward.

“I’m so sorry,” her voice quivered, “I didn’t know-“

“We’re at war,” Talos put a hand on her shoulder and looked at her softly, “I’ve got blood on my hands too… But we are here now, and I wouldn’t have managed that without your help.”

Carol nodded and before she could reply something another child approached her and soon got her to smile again when he showed her his high-score on the pinball game.

Fury grumbled something beside you, but you were too enamored by Carol’s smile as she looked at the young skrull, to understand what he said. What did catch your attention, however, was the troop of Kree soldiers who suddenly entered through the door you five had come through earlier.

All of you took an instinctive step back, the man who led them was holding Goose by her neck and tossed her on the ground, where she landed on her legs. She immediately made her way over to Fury. You glared at the kree, if you had to guess you’d say that was Yon-Rogg.

Carol took a step forward and the kree stopped a few feet in front of her.

“What have you done with your suit?” Yon-Rogg twisted his face in disgust.

“They got into her head,” a blue woman spat, “Just like we feared.”

Carol clenched her fist at her side. “You lied to me.”

“I helped you to become the best version of yourself,” her former commander retorted, his eyes wandered to where Carol’s fist started to glow and he smirked. The light flickered and with a cry of pain she fell to her knees clutching her neck.

“What’s given can be taken away,” Yon-Rogg said and took a step closer.

Carol tried to get back up, she wouldn’t let him beat her just because he had taken her powers away, but the kree activated a device that created some sort of energy field that helped him keep Carol in place.

Without giving it a second thought, you stepped forward, but before you knew it Yon-Rogg leashed out with his free arm and sent you flying into a wall.

You gasped in pain as you fell to the ground and you faintly heard someone shout your name. Groaning you tried to sit up and just as your vision cleared again you saw Carol collapse. You scrambled to your feet, ignoring the flashes of pain that ragged through you, but before you could do anything remotely useful one of the kree held a sword to your throat. You immediately stopped moving and glared at the man, but he only regarded you with something that could only be described as mild annoyance and so you could only watch helplessly as Yon-Rogg left with a few of his team members taking Carol with him.

You were brought over to Maria and Fury who regarded you with concerned glances, but you smiled letting them know it shouldn’t be you they were worried about. A couple of kree were guarding the skrull at the other end of the room while you were left with two others. One of them took Goose out of Fury’s arms while the blue one scanned her with a device, he had picked from his belt.

“Species: Flerken; threat: high,” it proclaimed.

You three frowned as the kree muzzled the poor thing.

“That’s a cat, not Hannibal Lecter,” Fury complained, but the kree ignored him and scanned him next.

“Species: human; threat: low to none.”

“That thing is definitely broken,” your boss declared.

“Aww, does that hurt your ego?” you teased and despite the situation Maria laughed beside you as Fury narrowed his eyes at you.

Whatever he wanted to reply was drowned out by the device that had been pointed at you. “Species: human – mutant; threat: can vary from low to high.”

You raised your eyebrows and looked up at the kree who was regarding you suspiciously. “Mate, I think your precious little thing there needs to be checked over.”

You felt Fury and Maria watching you closely, but you shrugged, what even was a mutant supposed to be? The kree didn’t give you any time to think about it any longer however, the one with the device grabbed you by your shirt and pulled you to your feet before shoving you in the direction of the skrull.

“Lock them and the skrulls up,” he told his comrade, “And blast the others into space.”

You tried to break out of your captor’s grip as you heard what they planned to do with your friends, but he pushed you to your knees leaving you to watch desperately as they led Maria, Fury and Goose away.

Maria cast a glance back at you and her eyes widened. “Y/N! Watch out-“

But it was too late, you felt a sharp pain at the back of your head and then everything turned black.

.

Carol Danvers: @wherethesinslie @th3nextsupreme

Summary: We go to space! Yayyy!

Warnings: Captain Marvel spoilers

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Reader

Words: 2639

You can find the links to the previous parts in the comments or on my masterlist (the link is in my bio) :)

.

“Come on, L/N,” you felt someone shake your shoulder, “No rest for the wicked.”

Groaning you opened your eyes and flinched back a little when you saw Fury hovering over you.

“Get ready,” he told you, you could swear he smirked a little, “Talos’ science guy is ready with the jet.”

While Fury left the living room again, you sat up on the couch and reached for the boots you had left beside the sofa before going to sleep – well, rather before taking a nap… The clock on the wall told you, you hadn’t slept more than two hours.

“‘He won’t be ready before dawn’ he said,” you grumbled, “It’s still fucking dark outside…”

Laughter from behind you made you jump up and turn around abruptly.

“So, I guess you aren’t a morning person, then,” Carol grinned at you.

“I am, if I had a proper night’s sleep…” you replied rolling your eyes and joined her on the way outside.

[[MORE]]

“If it’s any consolation the sun will start rising in about half an hour, so they weren’t that far off with their guess,” Carol nudged your side and you laughed.

“I like your new look by the way,” you said giving her a once over. She had changed her suit’s colours from teal, black and grey to red, blue and gold and it suited her rather well, if you dared to say so.

“Thanks,” she looked down at herself, “I had a little help from Monica.”

“Of course, I wouldn’t have trusted anyone else’s advice either,” you nodded, “Where is she by the way?”

“Her grandparents picked her up, she’ll be safe with them.”

You smiled at Carol and reached for hand to give it a reassuring squeeze, she felt guilty for bringing Maria and Monica this close to danger in the first place, you could see it in her eyes. She looked back at you smiling too and when you wanted to let go of her hand, she didn’t let you, instead Carol only tightened her grip around it.

Suddenly a bit shy, she evaded your gaze as you continued to walk, but you didn’t mind, not at all. The walk over the lawn was shorter than you wished it to be, soon you arrived at the little hangar, where you couldn’t help, but stare amazed at the quadjet. It had looked fancy even before the skrull had worked on it, but now it really nearly looked like a spaceship.

It was only when Maria cleared her throat and gave a pointed look at your and Carol’s intertwined hands, that you two jumped apart. While you both tried to cover your embarrassment Maria only laughed. Luckily, Fury was inside the jet with Talos, you were sure he wouldn’t have stopped teasing you the entire flight, if he had seen you.

“There you are!” Fury appeared again, the skrulls close on his heel. “Ready to go to space?”

You and Maria exchanged a glance, hell yeah, you were ready… Space for christ’s sake…

“It still works pretty much the same way as before,” Talos’ science guy told Carol, “Just a few changes here and there… You should be fine.”

“Thank you,” Carol replied.

The skrull nodded shortly and you started to frown.

“You aren’t coming with us?”

He shook his head and smiled sadly at you.

“He’ll stay behind,” Carol finally explained, “Yon-Rogg will track my signal back to this place and we need all the extra time we can get.”

“No way,” you protested.

“It was my idea,” the skrull interrupted you and smiled, “I’ll be fine.”

Before you or anyone else could protest further, he symmed Carol and, to be honest, that did shut you up for a while… You were torn somewhere in between being amazed and weirded out.

The skrull seemed amused by your reactions judging by the very Carol-like smirk on his lips. Fury only shook his head and picked Goose up who was walking around his legs.

“Come on, let’s get going,” he said.

While you boarded the jet, Talos stayed back, probably to say his farewells properly and you all gave him the time gladly. Maria and Carol walked into the cockpit, both feeling immediately at home. Behind their two seats were three more and it only took you and Fury to exchange one glance to agree that you’d take Talos in between the two of you, so while you took the seat behind Maria, he took the one behind Carol, leaving the one in the middle for your new ally.

Talos only rolled his eyes when he entered. “Take that creature away at least…”

“Not a chance,” Fury replied cooing at Goose, causing you to laugh. He narrowed his eyes at you. “One word to any other agent…” he threatened.

Smirking you raised your arms in surrender. “Don’t worry, your secret’s safe with me. No one at SHIELD will ever know ‘Don’t-you-dare-call-me-Nick’ Fury has a soft spot for kitties.”

Carol laughed in the pilot’s seat as she flicked a couple of switches. “Buckle up, folks.”

You did as she asked and grinned at her. “Ready, Danvers?”

She looked over her shoulder and grinned back at you. “Higher, further, faster, baby.”

Maria laughed beside her. “Something’s telling me this time you’re certainly going to keep that promise.”

Carol feigned hurt. “What do you mean, this time?”

Your attention was taken from the two women, when Talos leaned into your side. You shoved him back, but he still scooted closer to you and you realized he was just trying to get every possible inch of space between him and Goose. When Fury realized that too, he laughed and cuddled the cat even more.

“You really shouldn’t have that thing on your lap,” Talos tried to tell him, but your boss only smirked.

“As long as our alliance stands on shaky ground and you are frightened of her,” he proved his point by holding Goose into Talos’ direction, who instantly flinched back, “The cat stays.”

Talos’ frightened expression made way for a confused look. “What’s a cat?”

“Can I ask you a question?” Maria suddenly asked, stopping the two from bickering.

“Sure,” Talos shrugged.

“Can all of you change your appearance?”

“Physiologically? Yes.” He answered. “But it requires practice and, dare I say, talent to-“

“So, you could change into anything?” Maria interrupted.

“If I see it first…”

While Fury and Maria started to suggest the weirdest things for him to turn into, you zoned out, preferring the sight out of the front shield to their conversation. Finally, you were called back by Carol’s voice.

“Alright, guys,” she shot you a quick glance, “Hold on…”

The jet rattled and shook when you started to brake through the atmosphere, so much so, that you started to question the stability of the ship, especially considering the recent provisional adjustments… Luckily the ‘space turbulances’ (as Fury called it) were over nearly as soon as they started and you suddenly found yourself in complete absence of gravity.

The feeling of weightlessness was difficult to describe, but it was something you definitely wouldn’t forget all too quickly. You looked in wonder at your own arms, that had risen without you having any influence on it. It was then, that the realization, that you really were in space, settled in and you couldn’t help but laugh a little.

Carol soon pressed a few buttons that activated some sort of gravity stabilizer, it felt like something tugged at your stomach and for a second you feared you might grow sick. The feeling passed quickly though and you finally were able to focus on the absolutely marvelous sight on front of you. There were so many stars, stretching out until forever – but not a sign of Mar-Vell’s laboratory.

“Here it is,” Carol said, “We’re right were it’s supposed to be…”

“The question is,” Fury objected, “Is it in front or behind of all that nothing?”

Carol didn’t pay him any mind, instead she smiled and lifted her hand, she typed away on the little display on her forearm whereupon a huge spacecraft appeared in front of you. You’d be astounded, but the truth was, that wasn’t by far the craziest thing you had witnessed in the last 24 hours.

Carol and Maria piloted the jet into the landing dock of the lab, touching down gently and with no complications.

“That was amazing,” you whispered causing Talos to smile at you and give you a little pat on your shoulder, before exiting the jet quickly.

At first you blamed that on his want to get away from Goose, but you started to doubt that theory when it seemed that he couldn’t make his way through the lab fast enough. Carol kept up with his pace, while the rest of you decided to be a bit more careful when it came to exploring.

The inside of the lab reminded you more of a factory than of a spaceship, the faint buzz of the engine was omnipresent, but except for that and the echo of your footsteps it was completely silent.

You had walked through a couple of corridors, taking so many turns that you feared you might not find your way back to the hangar if you had to, when you finally reached a larger room, full of tech and other stuff, you wouldn’t have expected to find there… You really should have been gawking at the glowing blue cube in the center of the room, but while the others were already busy with that, you couldn’t help but wonder about the pin-ball machine at the other end of the room.

As you made your way over there you noticed toys lying in between scientific notes and underneath the tables. You turned around frowning and saw Fury rummaging through all the stuff too. You both spotted the steaming cup on the table at the same time and looked at each other alerted.

“We aren’t alone…” he said and in that same moment Talos started to make sounds that reminded you oddly of whale song.

Before you knew it, skrulls emerged from every corner of the ship, surrounding you. Talos looked around searching for something – someone and he didn’t have to do so for long… A woman appeared to your right and as if he sensed her Talos turned around. They took a tentative step closer to each other, before they ran into each other’s arms.

You smiled softly when they hugged each other as close as possible and a child walked out of the shadows, encouraged by her mother.

“He wasn’t looking for the Tesseract,” Maria whispered beside you.

Talos and his family turned around to you and his wife and child stepped back afraid when they spotted Carol.

“It’s all right,” Talos immediately comforted them, “She’s helped me find you.”

You turned to look at Carol, tears brimmed in her eyes as she took a few steps forward.

“I’m so sorry,” her voice quivered, “I didn’t know-“

“We’re at war,” Talos put a hand on her shoulder and looked at her softly, “I’ve got blood on my hands too… But we are here now, and I wouldn’t have managed that without your help.”

Carol nodded and before she could reply something another child approached her and soon got her to smile again when he showed her his high-score on the pinball game.

Fury grumbled something beside you, but you were too enamored by Carol’s smile as she looked at the young skrull, to understand what he said. What did catch your attention, however, was the troop of Kree soldiers who suddenly entered through the door you five had come through earlier.

All of you took an instinctive step back, the man who led them was holding Goose by her neck and tossed her on the ground, where she landed on her legs. She immediately made her way over to Fury. You glared at the kree, if you had to guess you’d say that was Yon-Rogg.

Carol took a step forward and the kree stopped a few feet in front of her.

“What have you done with your suit?” Yon-Rogg twisted his face in disgust.

“They got into her head,” a blue woman spat, “Just like we feared.”

Carol clenched her fist at her side. “You lied to me.”

“I helped you to become the best version of yourself,” her former commander retorted, his eyes wandered to where Carol’s fist started to glow and he smirked. The light flickered and with a cry of pain she fell to her knees clutching her neck.

“What’s given can be taken away,” Yon-Rogg said and took a step closer.

Carol tried to get back up, she wouldn’t let him beat her just because he had taken her powers away, but the kree activated a device that created some sort of energy field that helped him keep Carol in place.

Without giving it a second thought, you stepped forward, but before you knew it Yon-Rogg leashed out with his free arm and sent you flying into a wall.

You gasped in pain as you fell to the ground and you faintly heard someone shout your name. Groaning you tried to sit up and just as your vision cleared again you saw Carol collapse. You scrambled to your feet, ignoring the flashes of pain that ragged through you, but before you could do anything remotely useful one of the kree held a sword to your throat. You immediately stopped moving and glared at the man, but he only regarded you with something that could only be described as mild annoyance and so you could only watch helplessly as Yon-Rogg left with a few of his team members taking Carol with him.

You were brought over to Maria and Fury who regarded you with concerned glances, but you smiled letting them know it shouldn’t be you they were worried about. A couple of kree were guarding the skrull at the other end of the room while you were left with two others. One of them took Goose out of Fury’s arms while the blue one scanned her with a device, he had picked from his belt.

“Species: Flerken; threat: high,” it proclaimed.

You three frowned as the kree muzzled the poor thing.

“That’s a cat, not Hannibal Lecter,” Fury complained, but the kree ignored him and scanned him next.

“Species: human; threat: low to none.”

“That thing is definitely broken,” your boss declared.

“Aww, does that hurt your ego?” you teased and despite the situation Maria laughed beside you as Fury narrowed his eyes at you.

Whatever he wanted to reply was drowned out by the device that had been pointed at you. “Species: human – mutant; threat: can vary from low to high.”

You raised your eyebrows and looked up at the kree who was regarding you suspiciously. “Mate, I think your precious little thing there needs to be checked over.”

You felt Fury and Maria watching you closely, but you shrugged, what even was a mutant supposed to be? The kree didn’t give you any time to think about it any longer however, the one with the device grabbed you by your shirt and pulled you to your feet before shoving you in the direction of the skrull.

“Lock them and the skrulls up,” he told his comrade, “And blast the others into space.”

You tried to break out of your captor’s grip as you heard what they planned to do with your friends, but he pushed you to your knees leaving you to watch desperately as they led Maria, Fury and Goose away.

Maria cast a glance back at you and her eyes widened. “Y/N! Watch out-“

But it was too late, you felt a sharp pain at the back of your head and then everything turned black.

.

“Species: Flerken; threat: high,” it proclaimed.

You three frowned as the kree muzzled the poor thing.

“That’s a cat, not Hannibal Lecter,” Fury complained, but the kree ignored him and scanned him next.

“Species: human; threat: low to none.”

“That thing is definitely broken,” your boss declared.

“Aww, does that hurt your ego?” you teased and despite the situation Maria laughed beside you as Fury narrowed his eyes at you.

Whatever he wanted to reply was drowned out by the device that had been pointed at you. “Species: human – mutant; threat: can vary from low to high.”

You raised your eyebrows and looked up at the kree who was regarding you suspiciously. “Mate, I think your precious little thing there needs to be checked over.”

You felt Fury and Maria watching you closely, but you shrugged, what even was a mutant supposed to be? The kree didn’t give you any time to think about it any longer however, the one with the device grabbed you by your shirt and pulled you to your feet before shoving you in the direction of the skrull.

“Lock them and the skrulls up,” he told his comrade, “And blast the others into space.”

You tried to break out of your captor’s grip as you heard what they planned to do with your friends, but he pushed you to your knees leaving you to watch desperately as they led Maria, Fury and Goose away.

Maria cast a glance back at you and her eyes widened. “Y/N! Watch out-“

But it was too late, you felt a sharp pain at the back of your head and then everything turned black.

.

trail.content_abstract:
Note: All right, turns out I suck at planning… Long story short, there’ll be one more chapter (I think lol) and an epilogue, I suppose… I’m sorry? Idk… Anyway, I really like this chapter, I hope you do too, please let me know what you think <3

Summary: We go to space! Yayyy!

Warnings: Captain Marvel spoilers

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Reader

Words: 2639

You can find the links to the previous parts in the comments or on my masterlist (the link is in my bio) :)

.

“Come on, L/N,” you felt someone shake your shoulder, “No rest for the wicked.”

Groaning you opened your eyes and flinched back a little when you saw Fury hovering over you.

“Get ready,” he told you, you could swear he smirked a little, “Talos’ science guy is ready with the jet.”

While Fury left the living room again, you sat up on the couch and reached for the boots you had left beside the sofa before going to sleep – well, rather before taking a nap… The clock on the wall told you, you hadn’t slept more than two hours.

“‘He won’t be ready before dawn’ he said,” you grumbled, “It’s still fucking dark outside…”

Laughter from behind you made you jump up and turn around abruptly.

“So, I guess you aren’t a morning person, then,” Carol grinned at you.

“I am, if I had a proper night’s sleep…” you replied rolling your eyes and joined her on the way outside.

summary: So is this like an anti Carol danvers blog? Or just mar vell along side with her?
question: So is this like an anti Carol danvers blog? Or just mar vell along side with her?
answer:
Sorry, I haven’t seen the notification @maximummandike . Anyway, this is not an anti Carol Danvers blog, I like the character and I have followed her for many years, and I see her as a good legacy successor as Captain Marvel. On the other hand, Mar-Vell has been an important character for me and I don’t want to forget him or his legacy.

And yes, I’d love to see a Captain Marvel corps comic series, with Carol, Genis, Phyla, Monica, Noh-Varr, Mar-Vell and friends (Rick, Moondragon, Wendell, Adam Warlock, Avengers, cosmic stories, etc).

It slighty feels as though people had to be convince (even after the movie) how cute a couple Carol x Maria are and they have multiple scenes for inspiration. But although Carol & Valkyrie haven’t meet yet I have seen more of an uproar for that ship and come across multiple fanart. Is it a coincidence that the slow gradual ship contains a dark skin women while the other is a light skin black women? Now I’m not saying colorism is the only reason I believe that Carol x Valkyrie is being ship so hard. Just asking if maybe this helps promotes their “relationship”
